sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let set A = {1, 2, 3} and set B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of (A Δ B) and (B Δ A) and verify mathematically that it is not equal to the Cartesian product of (B Δ A) and (A Δ B), thus proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
